meanings.definition: In a forceful or aggressive manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke pushily, demanding attention from everyone.
meanings.sent2: He always drives pushily, honking at slower cars.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed pushily, wanting more treats.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled pushily through the trees, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scolded pushily, making sure the students understood the lesson.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to push or impose oneself on others
meanings.sent1: The pushily salesman tried to sell us unnecessary products.
meanings.sent2: She had a pushily attitude, always interrupting others.
meanings.sent3: The pushily squirrel kept stealing food from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His pushily behavior made it hard for others to express their opinions.
meanings.sent5: The pushily boss constantly micromanaged his employees.
